Legal_Issue: Did the RPD err in rejecting the applicants' refugee claims under sections 96 and 97 of the IRPA?
Credibility_Assessment: Doubted due to prolonged stay in the U.S. without seeking asylum
Evidence_Type: Subjective and objective evidence of fear of persecution
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Evaluation_Standard: Assessment of subjective and objective basis for fear
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in conduct, including extended illegal stay in the U.S. without seeking protection
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim determination and judicial review
Application_Error: Alleged error in rejection of claim based on credibility and evidence
Review_Outcome: No error found; RPD decision upheld
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Application_Factor: Failure to seek asylum in the U.S. despite prolonged stay
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether RPD applied correct legal and evidentiary standards
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence and inconsistent behavior undermining claimed fear
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of objective evidence, inconsistencies in testimony and actions
Credibility_Issues: Significant – prolonged stay in U.S. without seeking asylum undermined credibility
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RPD’s assessment of credibility and evidence
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court review of RPD decision)
Omission_Type: Failure to apply for asylum in interim country (U.S.)
